org.jtrim.property.swing

Interface SwingForwarderFactory<ListenerType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ListenerType - the type of the listener to be created

    public interface SwingForwarderFactory<ListenerType>
    Creates listeners invoking the run() method of a Runnable. This interface is intended to bridge the gap between Swing properties and properties in JTrim. That is, this interface is used when converting a Swing property to a property of JTrim, as done by SwingProperties.fromSwingSource.

    Thread safety

    This interface is required to be thread-safe. That is, its method is allowed to be called from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The method of this interface is required to be synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    SwingProperties.fromSwingSource

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ListenerType createForwarder(java.lang.Runnable listener)
      Creates and returns a new listener which will call the run() method of the specified Runnable when notified.

    • Method Detail

      • createForwarder

        ListenerType createForwarder(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Creates and returns a new listener which will call the run() method of the specified Runnable when notified.
        Parameters:
        listener - the Runnable whose run() method is to be called whenever the returned listener is notified of an event this SwingForwarderFactory is associated with.
        Returns:
        a new listener which will call the run() method of the specified Runnable when notified. This method may never return null and must return a new instance for each invocation.
